oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville and the camp of the Sixteenth Regiment of Ills. Vols. Inft. At Edgefield, Tennessee, circa 1863-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A pictorial representation in lithographic form of Nashivlle during the Civil War, with the camp of the Illinois 16th Volunteer Regiment at Edgefield in the foreground. The Cumberland River is seen in the background with gunboats and riverboats depicted. The state capitol building can be seen in the background overlooking the city of Nashville. Structures featured within the camp are the guard house, the headquarters, the hospital, the sutler, and the housing for the band.

Most of the lithograph depicts camp activities as might be seen during the Civil War. The lithograph was created by Theodore Schrader of St. Louis, Missouri. The 16th Regiment Illinois Infantry was organized at Quincy, Illinois, and mustered in May 24, 1861. They marched from Tuscumbia, Alabama to Nashville from August 25 through September 15, 1862. They saw action at Columbia on September 10, 1862. They participated in the Siege of Nashville from September 15 through November 6 of 1862.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schrader, Theodore
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Nashville (Tenn.) -- Maps; Cumberland River (Ky. And Tenn.); United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 16th
Maps; Military life
